repositories.brief_summary: Toplevel printing fixes and runtime improvements with active development on stdlib additions and transparent ascription features
repositories.new_features_summary: Fixed toplevel qualified label printing and minor GC collection improvements
repositories.new_features:
- Fixed **toplevel printing** of qualified labels to properly hide `Lib__Module` module paths when displaying variant constructors and record labels ([#14192](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14192)) by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron)
- Improved **runtime garbage collection** by removing outdated comment and reverting to more intuitive `caml_minor_collection()` function call ([#14187](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14187)) by [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes)
repositories.activity_summary: Eight new PRs opened covering stdlib additions, toplevel improvements, and ongoing transparent ascription work
repositories.activity:
- **Standard library expansion** with new `List.split_map` function providing generalized version of split operation ([#14185](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14185)) by [Jeremy Yallop](https://github.com/yallop), merged during the week
- **Toplevel initialization improvements** to make `-init` flag work properly with `-e` expression evaluation and script execution ([#14190](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14190)) by [@EmileTrotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon)
- **Runtime events documentation** clarification for GC statistics printing with `v=0x400` flag ([#14191](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14191)) by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist)
- **Transparent ascription implementation** continues with feature split between static and dynamic aliases ([#14064](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14064)) by [@clementblaudeau](https://github.com/clementblaudeau)
- **Tail call optimization control** through new `--no-inter-tail-calls` flag for better stack trace debugging ([#14186](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14186)) by [@medovina](https://github.com/medovina)
- **Modular explicits documentation** continues development to document the upcoming feature ([#14048](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14048)) by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche)
- **Minor typo fixes** in Format module comments merged ([#14194](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14194)) by [@smjleo](https://github.com/smjleo)
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on developer experience improvements through better debugging tools and standard library additions
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Developer debugging tools** with tail call optimization control and GC statistics improvements for better profiling and debugging capabilities ([#14186](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14186), [#14191](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14191))
- **Standard library completeness** through systematic addition of missing utility functions like `split_map` ([#14185](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14185))
- **Runtime system improvements** focused on multi-domain stability and correctness ([#14061](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14061), [#14187](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14187))
repositories.contributors_summary: Seven contributors active with Florian Angeletti and Nick Barnes delivering merged improvements, Jeremy Yallop adding stdlib functionality
repositories.contributors:
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) implemented toplevel printing fix for qualified labels ([#14192](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14192)) and provided extensive review feedback on transparent ascription work
- [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) cleaned up runtime GC code with comment and function call improvements ([#14187](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14187)) and reviewed runtime events changes
- [Jeremy Yallop](https://github.com/yallop) contributed new `List.split_map` function to standard library ([#14185](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14185))
- [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) worked on runtime events counter fixes and documentation improvements ([#14188](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14188), [#14189](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14189), [#14191](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14191))
- [@EmileTrotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) improved toplevel initialization behavior with `-init` flag fixes ([#14190](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14190))
- [@clementblaudeau](https://github.com/clementblaudeau) continued development on transparent ascription feature implementation ([#14064](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14064))
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) maintained modular explicits documentation and provided technical guidance across multiple discussions ([#14048](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14048))

repositories.brief_summary: User experience improvements with better error messages for invalid package names and documentation updates
repositories.new_features_summary: Enhanced error messages for invalid characters in package names with specific character display
repositories.new_features:
- **Enhanced error messages** for invalid package names now display the specific invalid character, improving debugging when users encounter malformed package names ([#6638](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6638))
- **Comprehensive test coverage** added for error message validation when invalid characters are detected in package names ([073c46b1](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/073c46b1e52ab2deaf8fa340a0c85a9c573c0cfa))
repositories.activity_summary: Documentation improvements for manual and man pages, plus ongoing portability work for Haiku support

- **Manual updates** by [Mathieu Barbin](https://github.com/mbarbin) adding mention of the `opam admin compare-versions` command for better discoverability ([#6596](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6596))
- **Haiku platform support** ongoing work by [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) adding missing package manager references, currently in draft status ([#6641](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6641))

repositories.brief_summary: Infrastructure maintenance with Nix configuration updates and code refactoring to reduce external dependencies
repositories.new_features_summary: Updated Nix development environment with newer OCaml tooling versions and removed OCaml 5.1 support
repositories.new_features:
- **Nix environment updates** including removal of OCaml 5.1 support, updated Merlin version for OCaml 5.3, updated flakes, and OCamlformat upgrade to version 0.27.0 ([#1550](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1550))
- **Documentation cleanup** by removing dead link to archived ocaml-language-server project ([#1549](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1549))
- **String handling refactor** eliminating uses of `Stdune.String` module ([#1551](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1551))
repositories.activity_summary: Multiple ongoing refactoring efforts to reduce Stdune library dependencies across the codebase
repositories.activity:
- **Stdune library dependency removal** initiative with several open PRs targeting different modules: List utilities ([#1480](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1480)), IO operations ([#1404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1404)), code generator utilities ([#1400](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1400)), and integer operations ([#1482](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1482))
- **Long-term refactoring work** with some PRs dating back to November 2024, indicating careful incremental approach to reducing external dependencies
- **Active development environment maintenance** showing commitment to keeping build infrastructure current with OCaml ecosystem changes
repositories.trends_summary: Systematic effort to reduce dependency on Stdune library and modernize development infrastructure
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Dependency reduction strategy** with focused effort to eliminate Stdune library usage across multiple modules, suggesting a move toward standard library or alternative solutions
- **Development environment modernization** with proactive updates to Nix configuration, OCamlformat versions, and OCaml version support matrix
- **Infrastructure maintenance priority** showing attention to keeping development tooling current and accessible
repositories.contributors_summary: Two contributors active: Rudi Grinberg led infrastructure and refactoring work, Mostafa Touny contributed documentation cleanup
repositories.contributors:
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) implemented Nix environment updates ([#1550](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1550)), String module refactoring ([#1551](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1551)), and maintains multiple ongoing dependency reduction PRs ([#1404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1404), [#1400](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1400), [#1480](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1480), [#1482](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1482))
- [Mostafa Touny](https://github.com/mostafatouny) contributed documentation maintenance by removing dead link to archived ocaml-language-server project ([#1549](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1549))

repositories.brief_summary: OpenBSD compatibility fix and GitHub Actions dependency update submitted as PRs, with ongoing discussion on toplevel directives issue
repositories.activity_summary: Platform compatibility improvements and CI infrastructure updates in development
repositories.activity:
- **OpenBSD compatibility** fix for `merlin_reader` functionality by [@omegametabroccolo](https://github.com/omegametabroccolo) addresses execve(2) requirement for argv to contain at least one element ([#1956](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1956))
- **GitHub Actions dependency** update by [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) bumping actions/download-artifact from v4 to v5 with breaking changes for single artifact downloads by ID ([#1955](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1955))
- Continued **issue discussion** on toplevel directives compatibility since OCaml 4.08 with additional user reports confirming the problem across multiple OCaml and Merlin versions ([#1023](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1023))
repositories.discussions_summary: Technical discussion on OpenBSD compatibility and toplevel directives behavior across OCaml versions
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **OpenBSD platform support** discussion by [@omegametabroccolo](https://github.com/omegametabroccolo) and [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) examining the fix for execve(2) requirements and ensuring compatibility across Unix distributions ([#1956](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1956))
- **Toplevel directives compatibility** issue reports from users experiencing syntax errors with #use and #require directives in OCaml scripts since version 4.08, with confirmations from multiple users across different OCaml and Merlin versions ([#1023](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1023))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on cross-platform compatibility and maintenance of CI infrastructure
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Cross-platform compatibility** efforts with specific attention to BSD systems and their unique system call requirements
- **CI/CD infrastructure maintenance** through automated dependency updates addressing breaking changes in GitHub Actions
- **Long-standing compatibility issues** receiving renewed attention from users across different OCaml versions
repositories.contributors_summary: Platform-specific fixes and dependency maintenance with community issue reporting
repositories.contributors:
- [@omegametabroccolo](https://github.com/omegametabroccolo) submitted OpenBSD compatibility fix for merlin_reader execve(2) requirements and engaged in technical discussion about cross-platform implications ([#1956](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1956))
- [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) automated GitHub Actions dependency update from actions/download-artifact v4 to v5 with detailed changelog and migration guidance ([#1955](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1955))
- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) participated in ongoing discussion about toplevel directives compatibility issues since OCaml 4.08 ([#1023](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1023))
- [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) provided review feedback on the OpenBSD compatibility fix, asking about potential issues on other Unix distributions ([#1956](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1956))

repositories.brief_summary: Major refactoring week with new fs-io and top-closure libraries, bootstrap improvements, and extensive test reorganization.
repositories.new_features_summary: Added support for Tangled ATproto repositories, introduced new fs-io and top-closure libraries, and enhanced bootstrap functionality.
repositories.new_features:
- **Tangled ATproto support** added to source management for ATproto-based code repositories ([d244e92](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/d244e92cde619338e85cacb80f3a56ec23b30510))
- **New fs-io library** introduced for file system I/O operations with optimized write functionality ([33a5a27](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/33a5a27c892a212f3beac3fcba091bdc8eb48c78), [08209c8](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/08209c80f769c99bdb409aa3b731939d6f3d076d))
- **New top-closure library** created for ocamllsp dependency management ([998ed66](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/998ed66a8667442e2531a71b81b2c4419eb85642), [63e813f](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/63e813fffc4a5434e0c3e78f2fbdc2d087d02c19))
- **Bootstrap script enhancements** with let syntax extension support, environment variable handling improvements, and local library generation refactoring ([d244e92](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/d244e92cde619338e85cacb80f3a56ec23b30510), [10d78dd](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/10d78dd6ab9c2a9886c3d6e138f98f79ff63d414), [99853ad](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/99853adcb287017b218b4063280ed6d93b36ff9d))
- **Melange runtime asset promotion** improvements for installed libraries with runtime dependencies ([984c512](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/984c5129bb4698629c136053213c256e5fb37477), [3e52549](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/3e52549902b195f14ee71d1048199616b0797e08))
- **CI infrastructure updates** including OCaml 5.4 bump and OCaml 4.08 bootstrap verification ([be7984b](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/be7984bd1cc6e5a759433500ed5387eb67f6a596), [890fe27](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/890fe27b46cd44d912f29b67dc06ede8df5e8996))
repositories.activity_summary: Extensive refactoring focused on bootstrap improvements, module organization, and comprehensive test suite restructuring.
repositories.activity:
- **Bootstrap module refactoring** by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) and [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) with improved dependency cycle error handling, cleanup of obsolete rules, and environment variable processing ([d974dad](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12162), [465435f](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12214), [a434c5d](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12211))
- **Rev_store cleanup and improvements** by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) with enhanced typing, file organization, and function cleanup ([573478a](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12195), [cc54631](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12191))
- **Test suite organization** with extensive restructuring moving test cases into dedicated directories for better organization ([078f4f9](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12205), [46fcc6c](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12201), [4a2328a](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12208), [1e54f17](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12207), [7c9b872](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12204))
- **Module system improvements** including renaming Dune_filesystem_stubs to Readdir, Source.Readdir to Source.Dir_contents, and making Module.Source.make arguments mandatory ([c91e8b1](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12150), [5c4f983](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12163), [b6785c3](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12154))
- **RPC module refactoring** moving public components to separate module and fixing dependency cycles ([e903d21](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12166), [f0b68cd](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12171))
- **OCaml-re vendor update** with comprehensive improvements to regex handling, compilation, and parsing ([05a5c13](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12196))
- **Action execution refactoring** removing display parameter and optimizing file operations ([86fe96d](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12187), [08209c8](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11978))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on package management improvements, better Docker/container support, and enhanced development tooling integration.
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Package management evolution** with discussions around Docker base images for dune pkg deployment ([#12177](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12177)), compiler caching improvements ([#12179](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12179)), and rebuild optimization challenges ([#12103](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12103))
- **Development experience improvements** including better conditional compilation support through configurator-style selection ([#12182](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12182)) and enhanced documentation with anchor link requests ([#12156](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12156))
- **Security and dependency management** with proposals to replace external program calls with OCaml libraries for better security and consistency ([#12185](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12185))
- **CI and testing infrastructure modernization** shown through the move to OCaml 5.4, Nix-based bootstrap testing for OCaml 4.02, and comprehensive test reorganization efforts
repositories.contributors_summary: Primary development by core maintainers with focused contributions on infrastructure, refactoring, and package management features.
repositories.contributors:
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) led bootstrap refactoring efforts, CI improvements including OCaml 5.4 bump, and various module system enhancements ([#12169](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12169), [#12217](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12217), [#12212](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12212), [#12182](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12182))
- [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) contributed extensive rev_store refactoring, CI infrastructure for OCaml 4.08 bootstrap testing, and RPC dependency cycle fixes ([#12179](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12179), [#12178](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12178), [#12215](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12215), [#12134](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12134))
- [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) reported and provided detailed analysis of package management rebuilding issues affecting productivity with the -j flag ([#12103](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12103))
- [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) proposed Docker base image solutions for dune pkg deployment scenarios, addressing modern container deployment needs ([#12177](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12177))
- [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) requested documentation improvements for better developer experience with anchor links ([#12156](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12156))
- [Coconut](https://github.com/Ccocconut) highlighted security concerns regarding external program dependencies and proposed OCaml library alternatives ([#12185](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12185))

repositories.brief_summary: Enhanced changelog automation with improved release scraper and added hundreds of historical OCaml platform release announcements.

repositories.activity_summary: Intensive changelog maintenance with over 6,000 lines of historical OCaml platform release announcements restored and organized.

repositories.brief_summary: Heavy development focused on small integer types, atomic locations, DWARF debugging, and backend optimizations
repositories.new_features_summary: Small integer types moved to stable, atomic locations API added, DWARF type debugging flag introduced
repositories.new_features:
- **Small integer types** moved from `stdlib_beta` to `stdlib_stable` including `Int`, `Int8`, `Int16`, `Int8_u`, `Int16_u`, and `Int_u` modules providing stable APIs for unboxed integer operations ([ae5ce4357a652830](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/ae5ce4357a652830))
- **Atomic locations API** added `Atomic.Loc` module for atomic operations on record fields and other locations, enabling atomic access to fields within non-atomic objects ([d47fc3042352bd48](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/d47fc3042352bd48), [4ad727295b75798](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/4ad727295b75798), [dbb981b459848d42](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/dbb981b459848d42))
- **DWARF type debugging** support with new `-ddwarf-types` compiler flag for debugging type generation in DWARF output ([ece8435c4a16d36](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/ece8435c4a16d36))
- **Void type support** in C stubs and primitives, eliminating upstream compatibility warnings and supporting void variants ([bbff682fa126203e](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/bbff682fa126203e), [e50954f1a39c111](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/e50954f1a39c111))
- **Memory profiler participation** API with `Gc.Memprof.participate` for better domain-specific profiling control ([c5bcd689cfb32adf](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/c5bcd689cfb32adf))
- **Unix function portability** improvements marking various functions as portable or non-portable for safer multi-domain usage ([99a981ed89174fff](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/99a981ed89174fff))
- **Enhanced configure support** for objcopy tool detection and ARM64 debugging patch inclusion ([7a7cda271c071fc](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/7a7cda271c071fc), [58a8a9556819e550](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/58a8a9556819e550))
repositories.activity_summary: Backend optimizations, type printing fixes, JSIR development, and prologue/epilogue refactoring dominated the week
repositories.activity:
- **Backend compilation improvements** including fixed peephole optimization rules preventing infinite loops ([#4513](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4513)), enhanced register equality checks ([#4519](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4519)), and prologue/epilogue instruction refactoring ([#4475](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4475), [#4479](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4479))
- **JSIR backend development** with extensive work by [@smjleo](https://github.com/smjleo) on exception handling ([#4501](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4501)), symbol scoping fixes ([#4442](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4442)), and multi-file compilation support ([#4456](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4456))
- **Type system fixes** resolving `assert false` error in mode currying for recursive types ([#4524](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4524)) and separability subsumption checks for or_null types ([#4517](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4517))
- **Runtime consistency** improvements with unified atomic counter operations ([#4514](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4514)) and scannable memory macros for better clarity ([#3722](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3722))
- **DWARF debugging enhancements** including compressed single function call output ([#4498](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4498)), comprehensive test suites ([#4468](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4468)), and type name emission improvements ([#4391](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4391))
- **Development tooling** updates with formatting integration ([#4491](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4491)), test generation improvements ([#4503](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4503)), and Nix configuration updates ([#4526](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4526))
repositories.discussions_summary: Community discussion about baremetal booting capabilities with guidance toward Unikraft and MirageOS solutions
repositories.notable_discussions: - **Baremetal framework discussion** initiated by [Nick Betteridge](https://github.com/nickbetteridge) asking about baremetal booting support for OxCaml ([#4504](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4504)), with [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) suggesting Unikraft as a foundation and [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) pointing to existing MirageOS compatibility
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on stabilizing core features, improving debugging capabilities, and advancing the JSIR backend for JavaScript compilation
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Feature stabilization** with small integer types graduating from beta to stable status, indicating maturation of the unboxed integer type system
- **Debugging infrastructure** expansion through comprehensive DWARF support improvements and new debugging flags for type generation
- **JavaScript compilation** backend development showing substantial progress with exception handling, multi-file support, and optimization integration
- **Memory management** enhancements through atomic locations API and improved memory profiler participation controls
- **Cross-platform reliability** improvements with Unix function portability annotations and ARM64-specific fixes

repositories.brief_summary: PPX override system implementation and major Flambda compiler merge bringing new type system features
repositories.new_features_summary: New PPX override system for document/locate commands and Flambda 5.2.0minus-17 type system enhancements
repositories.new_features:
- **PPX override system** with `@@@merlin.document` and `@@@merlin.locate` floating attributes allowing PPX-expanded files to override Merlin command outputs ([#177](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/177))
- **Interval tree implementation** for efficient querying of override mappings with caching support using Phase_cache ([#176](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/176))
- **Enhanced type system features** from Flambda 5.2.0minus-17 merge including new scalar types module, extended jkind system, and mode analysis improvements ([#178](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/178))
- **New magic numbers** and compiler flag support for updated Flambda integration ([#174](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/174), [#175](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/175))
repositories.activity_summary: Completion of PPX override architecture with comprehensive testing and multiple Flambda compiler synchronization PRs
repositories.activity:
- **PPX override architecture completion** by [Max Wang](https://github.com/maxmwang) with interval tree caching using GADTs and Phase_cache integration, including server-mode tests for cache hit tracking ([#176](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/176))
- **Comprehensive override testing** including 915 lines of unified tests for document/locate functionality and unit tests for interval tree implementation ([#177](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/177))
- **Flambda compiler synchronization** by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) through multiple merge PRs bringing upstream changes from 5.2.0minus-16 retag operations ([#174](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/174), [#175](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/175))
- **Large-scale compiler integration** with 31,372 additions and 23,609 deletions across 178 files including new scalar type system and enhanced uniqueness analysis ([#178](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/178))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on PPX ecosystem integration and keeping pace with upstream Flambda compiler developments
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **PPX ecosystem integration** with new override mechanisms enabling PPX tools to provide custom behavior for Merlin commands, particularly useful for code generation scenarios
- **Performance-conscious caching strategies** using interval trees and Phase_cache for efficient override lookup in large codebases with extensive PPX usage
- **Systematic upstream synchronization** with regular Flambda compiler merges to maintain compatibility with cutting-edge OCaml type system features
- **Comprehensive testing infrastructure** development with both unified and unit test coverage for new functionality
repositories.contributors_summary: Two contributors delivered PPX override system and compiler synchronization work with collaborative development approach
repositories.contributors:
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) led the Flambda compiler integration efforts with multiple merge PRs ([#174](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/174), [#175](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/175), [#178](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/178)) and facilitated [Max Wang](https://github.com/maxmwang)'s PPX improvements contribution by creating PR [#177](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/177) on his behalf
- [Max Wang](https://github.com/maxmwang) implemented the core PPX override system functionality including interval tree design, caching architecture, and comprehensive testing infrastructure ([#176](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/176), authored [#177](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/177))

group_summaries.group_overview:

group_summaries.brief_summary: Major dune refactoring week with new libraries, cross-platform compatibility fixes, and infrastructure maintenance across tools

group_summaries.new_features:

- **New fs-io library** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) for optimized file system I/O operations ([ocaml/dune@33a5a27](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/33a5a27c892a212f3beac3fcba091bdc8eb48c78))
- **New top-closure library** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) for ocamllsp dependency management ([ocaml/dune@998ed66](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/998ed66a8667442e2531a71b81b2c4419eb85642))

group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Infrastructure modernization** wave across multiple repositories with GitHub Actions checkout updates from v4 to v5 in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune), [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin), [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc), and [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) ([ocaml/merlin#1955](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1955), [ocaml/odoc#1376](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1376), [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2088](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2088))
- **Major development focus** concentrated in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with extensive refactoring, new library creation, and bootstrap improvements by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) and [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)
- **Cross-platform compatibility** efforts addressing Windows path separator issues in [ocaml/ocamlfind](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind) ([ocaml/ocamlfind#110](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/110)) and OpenBSD execve requirements in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) ([ocaml/merlin#1956](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1956))
- **User experience improvements** spanning multiple tools with enhanced error messages in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam), documentation proposals in [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/odoc), and dependency cleanup in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp)
group_summaries.activity_summary: Extensive refactoring in dune with bootstrap improvements, documentation enhancements in opam and odoc, plus ongoing dependency reduction work in ocaml-lsp
group_summaries.activity:
- **Bootstrap and module system refactoring** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) and [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) including dependency cycle error handling, RPC module improvements, and rev_store cleanup ([ocaml/dune#12162](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12162), [ocaml/dune#12171](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12171), [ocaml/dune#12195](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12195))
- **Comprehensive test suite reorganization** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) moving test cases into dedicated directories for better organization ([ocaml/dune#12205](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12205), [ocaml/dune#12208](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12208))
- **Documentation improvements** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) for opam pin man page and [Mathieu Barbin](https://github.com/mbarbin) adding compare-versions command reference ([ocaml/opam#6631](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6631), [ocaml/opam#6596](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6596))
- **Stdune library dependency removal** initiative in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) targeting multiple modules including List utilities, IO operations, and String handling ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1480](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1480), [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1404](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1404), [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1551](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1551))
- **File magic handling improvements** in [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) addressing unmarshalling prefix issues ([ocaml/odoc#1375](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1375))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **GitHub Actions infrastructure coordination** with automated [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) updates upgrading actions/checkout from v4 to v5 across [ocaml/merlin#1955](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1955), [ocaml/odoc#1376](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1376), and [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2088](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2088)
- **Dependency management evolution** with [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) creating new top-closure library for ocamllsp dependency management ([ocaml/dune@998ed66](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/998ed66a8667442e2531a71b81b2c4419eb85642)) while [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) works to reduce Stdune dependencies ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1480](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1480))
- **Cross-platform compatibility coordination** with Windows path issues in [ocaml/ocamlfind#110](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/110) and OpenBSD execve fixes in [ocaml/merlin#1956](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1956) highlighting platform-specific challenges across the tools ecosystem
- **[Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) contributions** spanning both [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) bootstrap refactoring and [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) dependency reduction efforts, showing coordinated development across related tools
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Documentation UX enhancement proposals** in [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) by [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) including copyable code blocks ([ocaml/odoc#1380](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1380)), admonitions for warnings ([ocaml/odoc#1378](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1378)), code highlighting ([ocaml/odoc#1379](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1379)), and signature hover tooltips ([ocaml/odoc#1377](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1377))
- **API-to-source navigation** design discussion in [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) by [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) exploring navigation between documentation and implementation files ([ocaml/odoc#1374](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1374))
- **Package management deployment** discussion in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) around Docker base images for dune pkg by [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) addressing container deployment scenarios ([ocaml/dune#12177](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12177))
- **Security considerations** raised in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Coconut](https://github.com/Ccocconut) proposing replacement of external programs with OCaml libraries for better security ([ocaml/dune#12185](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12185))
- **Long-standing compatibility** issue discussion in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) regarding toplevel directives since OCaml 4.08 with user reports confirming cross-version problems ([ocaml/merlin#1023](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1023))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Infrastructure standardization** with coordinated GitHub Actions updates across multiple repositories demonstrating ecosystem-wide maintenance practices
- **Cross-platform compatibility focus** addressing platform-specific issues in Windows (path separators) and OpenBSD (system call requirements) showing attention to diverse deployment environments
- **Documentation-driven development** with multiple repositories prioritizing user experience through better error messages, documentation improvements, and UX enhancement proposals
- **Dependency architecture evolution** with [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) creating specialized libraries while [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) reduces dependencies, indicating maturing approach to modular design
- **Security-conscious development** emerging through discussions about replacing external program dependencies with native OCaml implementations for improved security posture

group_summaries.brief_summary: Major work on oxcaml core development, Merlin PPX integration, and Flambda compiler synchronization
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Small integer types stabilized, atomic locations API, PPX override system, and DWARF debugging enhancements
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Small integer types stabilized** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) moving `Int`, `Int8`, `Int16`, `Int8_u`, `Int16_u`, and `Int_u` modules from `stdlib_beta` to `stdlib_stable` for unboxed integer operations ([ae5ce4357a652830](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/ae5ce4357a652830))
- **Atomic locations API** added `Atomic.Loc` module enabling atomic operations on record fields and other locations within non-atomic objects ([d47fc3042352bd48](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/d47fc3042352bd48))
- **PPX override system** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with `@@@merlin.document` and `@@@merlin.locate` attributes allowing PPX-expanded files to customize command outputs ([oxcaml/merlin#177](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/177))
- **DWARF type debugging** with new `-ddwarf-types` compiler flag for debugging type generation in DWARF output ([ece8435c4a16d36](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/ece8435c4a16d36))
- **Void type support** in C stubs eliminating upstream compatibility warnings ([bbff682fa126203e](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/bbff682fa126203e))
- **Memory profiler participation API** with `Gc.Memprof.participate` for domain-specific profiling control ([c5bcd689cfb32adf](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/c5bcd689cfb32adf))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Core compiler development** dominated by [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with 17 contributors delivering feature stabilization, backend optimizations, and JSIR development
- **Editor tooling enhancements** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with PPX override system implementation and comprehensive Flambda compiler synchronization
- **Repository activity concentration** with only oxcaml/oxcaml and oxcaml/merlin showing activity, while oxcaml/opam-repository, oxcaml/js_of_ocaml, and janestreet/opam-repository remained inactive
group_summaries.activity_summary: Backend optimizations, type system fixes, JSIR development, and comprehensive Flambda integration work
group_summaries.activity:
- **Backend compilation improvements** including peephole optimization fixes preventing infinite loops ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4513](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4513)) and register equality enhancements ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4519](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4519))
- **JSIR backend development** by [Leo Lee](https://github.com/smjleo) with 11+ merged PRs covering exception handling ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4501](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4501)), symbol scoping ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4442](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4442)), and multi-file compilation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4456](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4456))
- **Type system fixes** resolving recursive type printing assertions ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4524](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4524)) and separability subsumption for or_null types ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4517](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4517))
- **Flambda compiler integration** by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) with multiple merge PRs bringing 5.2.0minus-17 features ([oxcaml/merlin#178](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/178))
- **PPX override architecture** completion by [Max Wang](https://github.com/maxmwang) with interval tree caching and comprehensive testing ([oxcaml/merlin#176](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/176))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Compiler synchronization** between [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) and [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with Flambda 5.2.0minus-17 integration bringing shared type system enhancements and magic number updates
- **JavaScript compilation alignment** with [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) JSIR backend development potentially supporting future [oxcaml/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/js_of_ocaml) integration
- **PPX tooling ecosystem** development in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) creating infrastructure that could benefit code generation workflows across the oxcaml repositories
group_summaries.notable_discussions: - **Baremetal framework discussion** initiated by [@nickbetteridge](https://github.com/nickbetteridge) about baremetal booting support ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4504](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4504)), with [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) suggesting Unikraft as a foundation and pointing to existing MirageOS compatibility solutions
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Feature stabilization focus** with small integer types graduating from beta to stable, indicating maturation of the unboxed integer type system in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml)
- **Advanced debugging infrastructure** expansion through comprehensive DWARF support improvements and new debugging flags for type generation
- **PPX ecosystem integration** with override mechanisms in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) enabling PPX tools to provide custom behavior for editor commands
- **JavaScript compilation backend progress** with substantial JSIR development showing exception handling, multi-file support, and optimization integration
- **Systematic upstream synchronization** with regular Flambda compiler merges maintaining compatibility with cutting-edge OCaml type system features

group_summaries.brief_summary: Active development in ocaml/ocaml with toplevel fixes, runtime improvements, and ongoing stdlib expansion work
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Fixed toplevel qualified label printing and improved minor GC collection behavior
group_summaries.new_features:

- Improved **runtime garbage collection** by removing outdated comment and reverting to more intuitive `caml_minor_collection()` function call ([ocaml/ocaml#14187](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14187)) by [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes)
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Primary activity** concentrated in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) with eight new PRs opened covering developer experience improvements, runtime optimizations, and standard library additions ([ocaml/ocaml#14185](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14185), [ocaml/ocaml#14186](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14186), [ocaml/ocaml#14187](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14187), [ocaml/ocaml#14190](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14190), [ocaml/ocaml#14191](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14191), [ocaml/ocaml#14192](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14192))
- **Seven active contributors** delivered merged improvements and ongoing feature development with focus on debugging capabilities and stdlib completeness

weekly_summary.brief_summary: Major development across oxcaml compiler, ecosystem package expansion, and dune release with tools infrastructure modernization
weekly_summary.new_features_summary: Small integer types stabilized in oxcaml, enhanced error display in opam, and new web frameworks plus TUI libraries in opam-repository
weekly_summary.new_features:
- __RUMINANT:core__ Fixed **toplevel printing** of qualified labels to properly hide `Lib__Module` module paths when displaying variant constructors and record labels ([ocaml/ocaml#14192](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14192)) by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron)
- __RUMINANT:core__ Improved **runtime garbage collection** by removing outdated comment and reverting to more intuitive `caml_minor_collection()` function call ([ocaml/ocaml#14187](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14187)) by [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Small integer types stabilized** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) moving `Int`, `Int8`, `Int16`, `Int8_u`, `Int16_u`, and `Int_u` modules from `stdlib_beta` to `stdlib_stable` for unboxed integer operations ([ae5ce4357a652830](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/ae5ce4357a652830))
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Atomic locations API** added `Atomic.Loc` module enabling atomic operations on record fields and other locations within non-atomic objects ([d47fc3042352bd48](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/d47fc3042352bd48))
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **PPX override system** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with `@@@merlin.document` and `@@@merlin.locate` attributes allowing PPX-expanded files to customize command outputs ([oxcaml/merlin#177](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/177))
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **DWARF type debugging** with new `-ddwarf-types` compiler flag for debugging type generation in DWARF output ([ece8435c4a16d36](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/commit/ece8435c4a16d36))
- __RUMINANT:multicore__ **Fiber.any cancellation behavior** improved in [ocaml-multicore/eio#806](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/806) to prioritize returning computed values over external cancellation, ensuring results are preserved when available even if parent context is cancelled
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Web framework vif 0.0.1~beta1** for OCaml 5 by [Calascibetta Romain](https://github.com/dinosaure) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28344](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28344))
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **HTTP client hurl 0.0.1~beta1** command-line tool by [Calascibetta Romain](https://github.com/dinosaure) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28343](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28343))
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **TUI library bogue 20250815** with SDL2-based animations by [珊瑚](https://github.com/sanette) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28345](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28345))
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **YOCaml 2.4.0 static site generator** with 12 packages including new template chains and snapshots support by [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28331](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28331))
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Enhanced changelog scraper automation** with ability to generate PR suggestions for missing OCaml platform releases from GitHub projects, including automated file generation and improved metadata tracking ([ocaml/ocaml.org@8f877f5f1](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/8f877f5f1a67fe45c00a319827d730137fc3ecc8))
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Tangled ATproto support** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) for ATproto-based code repositories ([ocaml/dune@d244e92](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/d244e92cde619338e85cacb80f3a56ec23b30510))
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **New fs-io library** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) for optimized file system I/O operations ([ocaml/dune@33a5a27](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/33a5a27c892a212f3beac3fcba091bdc8eb48c78))
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Enhanced error messages** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) now display specific invalid characters in package names for better debugging ([ocaml/opam#6638](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6638))
weekly_summary.group_overview:
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Core compiler development** dominated by [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with 17 contributors delivering feature stabilization, backend optimizations, and JSIR development alongside comprehensive Merlin PPX integration
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Package ecosystem expansion** with 25+ new packages added to [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) spanning web frameworks, HTTP clients, TUI libraries, and developer tools plus historical content restoration on [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org)
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Infrastructure modernization** wave across multiple repositories with GitHub Actions checkout updates, extensive dune refactoring by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) and [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter), and release of Dune 3.20.0~alpha4
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Active development** in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) with 8 new PRs covering developer experience improvements, runtime optimizations, and standard library additions from 7 contributors
- __RUMINANT:multicore__ **Focused improvements** in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) with fiber behavior refinements and process management capabilities development
weekly_summary.activity_summary: Standard library expansion, comprehensive refactoring across tools, intensive maintenance with thousands of historical content restorations
weekly_summary.activity:
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Standard library expansion** with new `List.split_map` function providing generalized version of split operation ([ocaml/ocaml#14185](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14185)) by [Jeremy Yallop](https://github.com/yallop), merged during the week

- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Stdune library dependency removal** initiative in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) targeting multiple modules including List utilities, IO operations, and String handling ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1480](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1480))
